text: After much misery, I have finally, *finally* arrived at an nvim configuration that uses Julia LSP that isn't total shit and is actually usable.  If anyone is interested in my setup, you can see it [here](<https://gitlab.com/ExpandingMan/dotfiles/-/blob/master/home/.config/nvim/init.vim>)

text: unicode completion is to your satisfaction?

elements.text: unicode completion is to your satisfaction?

text: yes, although I go through some strange hoops.  I use my own [custom source](<https://gitlab.com/ExpandingMan/compe-latex>) for the nvim-compe completion plugin, which provides my tab-completion, but I *also* use `julia-vim` for latex-to-unicode as I type (can't get compe to do this).  As far as I can tell they do not conflict with eachother
